column5: The title kinda says it all...  I have a fair bit of water scale on my motor...  What do you guys use to clean it???  I was thinking magic eraser....
I would try vinegar first or perhaps CLR.
Vinegar works great. Magic eraser will work but it is a subtle abrasive.
I use CLR, it works great.
Clean with vinegar & water solution, then give it a good treatment of auto or marine wax to protect against UV and hard water spots.
spray 9 marine works great as well
Sounds like vinigar...  I'd do that tonight but the wife brought it to work to descale the coffee machine....  Cripes...  Lol

Mike .. Use 50/50 water (spray bottle and micro fibre cloths )and vinegar not straight vinegar .  Wipe boat down every trip you never have water marks take 5 min to do . If stains are bad I use clr soap and water mix . Don't let it dry and water very well after !
Thanks Greg... Wanna keep the new yammy looking good...  Btw... Nice boat...
x2... 50/50 vinegar water. I use baby clothes to wipe, clean and wax.  Waxing will help a lot.
